tachyon.client.keyvalue

Class LinearProbingIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.client.keyvalue.LinearProbingIndex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Index

    @NotThreadSafe
public final class LinearProbingIndex
extends Object
implements Index
    Index structure using linear probing. It keeps a collection of buckets. Each bucket stores a fingerprint (a byte) and an offset (an int) indicating where to find the key and the value in the payload.

    The index hash table looks like: ===================================== | fingerprint (byte) | offset (int) | ===================================== | fingerprint (byte) | offset (int) | ===================================== | ... | If fingerprint is zero, it indicates the bucket is empty.

        public ByteBuffer nextKey(ByteBuffer currentKey,

        Description copied from interface: Index
        Gets the next key relative to the current provided key.

        This could be more efficient than iterating over Index.keyIterator(PayloadReader) to find the next key.

        Specified by:
        nextKey in interface Index
        Parameters:
        currentKey - the current key, or null if there is no initial key known yet
        reader - reader to access key-value payload
        Returns:
        the next key, or null if there are no remaining keys

      • keyIterator

        public Iterator<ByteBuffer> keyIterator(PayloadReader reader)
        Description copied from interface: Index
        Gets an iterator to iterate over all keys.

        This could be more efficient than repeatedly calling Index.nextKey(ByteBuffer, PayloadReader).

        Specified by:
        keyIterator in interface Index
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an iterator of keys, the iterator does not support remove
